channel.title: Where do i put this code?
channel.description: So i was following a tut and i was wondering where i put this code [code] public void sendPricecheckerItems(int[] items, int[] itemsN, int[] prices) { int start = 280002; for(int b= 0; b < items.length; b++) { if(items[b] > 0) { getPA().sendFrame34(items[b], 0, start, itemsN[b]); getPA().sendFrame126(""+prices[b], b + 50); start++; } }} [/code]

item.title: Where do i put this code?
item.dc:creator: @PvPXile PvPXile
item.description:
@PvPXile wrote:

oh price checker, put it in player.java as that handles money

Read full topic

@Team_Rocket wrote:

So i was following a tut

I suggest you place the piece of Code where the Tutorial tells you to. If it doesn’t, then it probably wants you to put at least a little effort into it yourself. Please try this for me. Let go of our hands and be a brave soldier. I promise misplacing this won’t harm your Source.

item.title: Where do i put this code?
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

public void sendPricecheckerItems(int[] items, int[] itemsN, int[] prices) { int start = 280002; for(int b= 0; b < items.length; b++) { if(items[b] > 0) { getPA().sendFrame34(items[b], 0, start, itemsN[b]); getPA().sendFrame126(""+prices[b], b + 50); start++; } } }

It’s a method, so you declare it somewhere it will fit neatly. Usually with your other methods.

EDIT:

Cleaned the code for you. And since it’s a shop, you’ll have to put it in a shops file, most likely the once that uses the method.

Read full topic
